settings.text: Stay ahead of deadlines and changes
Key dates, common questions, and practical tips to keep your finances on track.

settings.title: Q4 Estimated Tax Payment
settings.description: Fourth quarter estimated tax payment due for self-employed individuals and businesses.

settings.title: Individual Tax Returns Due
settings.description: Deadline for filing individual income tax returns or requesting an extension.

settings.title: Q3 Estimated Tax Payment
settings.description: Third quarter estimated tax payment due. Also: S-Corp and partnership extended returns due.

settings.title: Extended Individual Returns Due
settings.description: Final deadline for individual returns that received an extension.

settings.question: What documents do I need for my tax return?
settings.answer: You'll typically need W-2s from employers, 1099s for freelance or investment income, receipts for deductible expenses, mortgage interest statements (1098), property tax records, charitable donation receipts, and prior year tax returns for reference.

settings.question: When should I file my business taxes?
settings.answer: Deadlines vary by entity type. S-Corps and partnerships are due March 15. C-Corps and sole proprietors file by April 15. Extensions are available but only extend the filing deadline, not the payment deadline.

settings.question: Should I form an LLC or S-Corp?
settings.answer: It depends on your revenue, self-employment tax situation, and growth plans. LLCs offer simplicity and flexibility. S-Corps can save on self-employment taxes once your income reaches a certain level. We help you evaluate both options based on your specific numbers.

settings.question: Can I deduct my home office?
settings.answer: Yes, if you use a dedicated space in your home regularly and exclusively for business. You can use the simplified method ($5 per square foot, up to 300 sq ft) or the regular method based on actual expenses proportional to your home's square footage.

settings.question: What happens if I miss a deadline?
settings.answer: Late filing penalties are typically 5% of unpaid taxes per month, up to 25%. Late payment penalties are 0.5% per month. Filing an extension avoids the filing penalty but not the payment penalty. Contact us immediately if you've missed a deadline — we can help minimize penalties.

settings.question: How much should I set aside for estimated taxes?
settings.answer: A general guideline is 25–30% of net self-employment income for federal taxes, plus your state rate. We recommend quarterly check-ins to adjust based on actual income and deductions throughout the year.

settings.question: Do I need a bookkeeper or just a tax preparer?
settings.answer: If you have more than a handful of transactions per month, a bookkeeper keeps your records organized year-round and makes tax time much smoother. A tax preparer alone works best for simple situations. Most growing businesses benefit from both.

settings.question: How do I choose the right accounting software?
settings.answer: QuickBooks Online is the most popular choice and integrates well with most banks and apps. Xero is great for businesses with international needs. FreshBooks works well for service-based freelancers. We can help you set up and optimize whichever platform fits your workflow.

settings.title: Get tax tips and deadline reminders
settings.description: Monthly updates on tax law changes, filing tips, and important deadlines. No spam, just useful information.
